thread.title_full: NBA Buzz: Golden State's Steve Kerr will not coach on opening night vs. Pelicans - NOLA.com

title: NBA Buzz: Golden State's Steve Kerr will not coach on opening night vs. Pelicans - NOLA.com
text:
Golden State coach Steve Kerr is still suffering from back surgery complications that will prevent him from coaching in Tuesday night's opener against the New Orleans Pelicans at Oracle Arena. 
Interim coach Luke Walton will continue his role into the regular season. 
The Warriors are scheduled to have their ring ceremony before the game. The Warriors won their first NBA championship since 1975 last season. Pelicans coach Alvin Gentry was Kerr's lead assistant in charge of the offense. 
Kerr ruptured a disk in his back during Game 5 of the NBA Finals in June. Since then, Kerr has had two surgeries to repair the injury, one on July 28 and another on Sept. 4. The Warriors announced on Oct. 1 that Kerr would be taking a leave of absence and Walton would serve as interim coach.
